Name: Cubdy
Description: This Nexomon is usually very distracted making soft noises and mumbling while absorbed in its thoughts. However, it is among the most intelligent of Nexomon.

Name: Cloddy
Description: A small cuddly Nexomon enveloped in fluffy fur that helps it keep balance on its tiny legs.

Name: Lukuma
Description: When a Cubdy evolves into Lukuma it becomes very grumpy and aggressive, as well as territorial. Yet, it tends to space out from time to time.

Name: Kolphur
Description: This scorching pebble has a magma core which also forms its one eye. When chasing them, be careful not to trip on their trail or your shoes might melt.

Name: Bloopish
Description: This colorful water Nexomon moves in large groups. Its shiny scales produce an amazing light effect underwater.

Name: Moltano
Description: This massive magma cyclopes will show you the meaning of pain. Stay away from it by all means.

Name: Glamoory
Description: Beauty and power can be found on its silky fins. Fishermen are extra careful when it appears as they might end up facing the Queen of the Sea.

Name: Spikarm
Description: Once a Spikus is able to stand on two feet, it learns how to shoot its thorns. They also develop great admiration for their newly acquired arms.

Name: Sulphlo
Description: When reaching adulthood, Kolphurs fulfill their dreams and transform in a small volcano. Hot bubbles of Sulphur can be seen moving throughout its boiling eye.

Name: Spikus
Description: A merry but un-huggable Nexomon who likes to jump and uses its spikes during battle and for protection against predators.

Name: Gemock
Description: Gemocks use the power of minerals to empower their jeweled limbs and generate their levitation powers.

Name: Pebglem
Description: Pebglem are very quiet Nexomon that can project light from the gem fin in their head. They can be noisy when happy though.

Name: Thornox
Description: Thornox can throw projectile spikes from its knees and shoulders, combined with cool dance moves and extreme accuracy.

Name: Glimoory
Description: Style and swiftness. Victory with glamour. The appeal of this Nexomon is equivalent to its skill in battle.

Name: Heliventus
Description: Heliventus keep their hard Helipa shell as a helmet, for they are natural air aces. Combined with their superior wind power, Heliventus know no fear.

Name: Heliwurm
Description: Heliwurms can manipulate wind by using their windmill shaped antenna. Do not be fooled by its fluffy look, they can summon powerful gusts of wind.

Name: Gemaxar
Description: Gemaxars are mineral Nexomon with total control of the magnetic fields. The crystal shards around them are like autonomous independent limbs for defense.

Name: Helipa
Description: When evolved, Heliwurm encloses in a cocoon and goes airborne.

Name: Zasp
Description: Zasps are faster and have more complex roles in the colony than Zumbles. They emit electro-magnetic fields to disorient predators from the hive.

Name: Zumble
Description: Zumbles navigate and communicate with their hive through their two antennas, which channel positive and negative electric charges respectively.

Name: Griff
Description: Double the curiosity and bravery of other felines. This Nexomon has the courage of a true king.

Name: Dreddiful
Description: An advanced spectral manifestation. No one has ever withstood the glare of the red eyes on its hands. A very cold wind blows before it appears during very dark nights.

Name: Cerebrius
Description: Tentacles play a major defense role on a Cerebrius, allowing it to detect enemies all around him.

Name: Zappnic
Description: Zappnics are the highest class in the electric hive. Their stings store enough electric charge to stun anyone.

Name: Skerdi
Description: A basic spectral form yet to be studied. Their grumpy face does not match their kind and gentle actions.

Name: Octollect
Description: The supreme mind of the ocean. Octollects have developed their psychic powers to the point where they can lure their lunch to them.

Name: Lioness
Description: Lioness has a majestic figure, plus its great strength makes them a foe to be respected. Their roar can be heard up to a distance of 5 miles.

Name: Griffgar
Description: Griffgar manes might vary in size depending on their age. They like to get into practice fights to hone their skills, so one day they can lead the pack.

Name: Aferaid
Description: They are more scared of tamers than the other way around. But most encounters end up with a fainted tamer.

Name: Flizard
Description: Flizards are easier to spot on hot days when they are more active. However, when they gather enough heat, some might shine with a bright red glow at night.

Name: Branipus
Description: From the depths of the ocean comes this squishy friend. Its brain power allows him to levitate for some time.

Name: Stinger
Description: This fire Nexomon likes to hide under sand or heavy rocks. Usually short tempered, it really like quiet places, so noises can easily make them angry. Its design was directly taken from the predecessor game Micromon.

Name: Moonsting
Description: They feature amazing reflexes on their tails and a reinforced armor. This fire Nexomon is famous on all battlefields.

Name: Sunknight
Description: This fire Nexomon is not only heavily armored, but also has fire moving along its tail, making it very difficult to approach.

Name: Shromporo
Description: You might venture through the forest without even noticing this Nexomon. It prefers dark corners in a thick foliage where it can grow and feed.

Name: Fortank
Description: The amount of vegetation around its tower and legs shows just how slow this Nexomon is. It compensates its slow speed with an unbreakable defense and resistance to attack.

Name: Shromboff
Description: A mean looking Nexomon usually found in the middle of the forest. It means double trouble because of its double heads.

Name: Tuskant
Description: A stomping water Nexomon. It features twin water cannons in each arm.

Name: Faucefant
Description: Faucefant has a playful personality. It enjoys rolling over and showering their friends by surprise while hiding in the grass.

Name: Shrombrela
Description: The more spores, the more energy. It blooms an extra head to collect more humidity from the air.

Name: Larkito
Description: Larkitos live fast and curious, with very short periods of activity followed by short naps. They are easily blown away when flying at high altitude.

Name: Draniphant
Description: Draniphants are all about attention, they shoot water from their trunk to catch everybody’s attention.

Name: Chibbit
Description: Some say Chibbits are a failed experiment because they live near to scientific facilities, but recent investigations have proven that they have a natural origin.

Name: Sakka
Description: Sakkas can fly higher and faster than Moskas, their annoying buzzing is so sharp that it can break thin glass.

Name: Fortle
Description: Fortles are slow but a tough little Nexomon. They are thrilled to play with others by carrying them on their shells. This characteristic makes them very popular with kids.

Name: Moska
Description: Moskas withstand the forces of the wind better than Larkitos, their complex eyes allow them to see any approaching object at slow motion.

Name: Fortoise
Description: Their defense allows them to resist almost any attack while securing certain victory. They are like a walking fortress and hence the name.

Name: Xotor
Description: Xotors are a proof of Chibbits natural origin, their hard crystal dome protects their biological core, which acts as both a brain and a heart.

Name: Dreaver
Description: Dreavers have become very popular nowadays as their psychic powers seem to be very efficient for preventing bad dreams.

Name: Dredmore
Description: While this Nexomon has a very long history, its origins are still unknown. Maybe for the best...

Name: Dredrone
Description: There are legends connecting Dredrone to inter-dimensional portals. Its inner strings produce a soft sound with lullaby-like effects.

Name: Ghouze
Description: This creepy Nexomon is less dangerous than it appears. Don't let it fool you though! It tends to lose people in the wild by either scaring them or misguiding them.

Name: Taipluff
Description: An apprentices of inner martial arts. It seeks to learn the ways of softness and are already masters of fluffiness.

Name: Mazecter
Description: The only physical part of this Nexomon is the iron maze on its tail, which it uses to lay on sleeping people or Nexomon to induce nightmares.

Name: Fistuff
Description: This Nexomon combines the soft grace of martial arts with some good old-school pummeling. It can move from one style to another without problem and can also use its tail to attack.

Name: Odiborg
Description: Odiborgs have complex circuitry and mechanics within their bodies. Each of their three sensors or eyes is independent of each other.

Name: Ninstuff
Description: It combines fighting styles in its soft movements. A master of timing and evasion, almost as if it was psychic.

Name: Snaibble
Description: A bubble blowing Nexomon which stores water in its very hard shell. They eye-like part of its shell is for camouflage purposes.

Name: Kerosion
Description: More volatile and angrier than most Nexomon, it translates this to power, but only on command for the most seasoned tamers.

Name: Peltry
Description: Don't upset this Nexomon! The awful smell of its tears causes everybody in the surrounding area to start crying too.

Name: Onin
Description: This joyful plant Nexomon has a great sense of friendship and loyalty, and an unfortunate smell that not everybody likes.

Name: Snaiflow
Description: It walks on two feet and can run very fast, leaving a slime trail in its wake that can be either very sticky or very slippery.

Name: Bouldion
Description: Its tiny legs aren't built for running, so it rolls around to move. The little mace on the end of its tail is said to be as tough as diamond.

Name: Snaijet
Description: Its shell boasts two horns on an already mean-looking shell, but it really didn't need it to scare its opponents anymore, did it? Its sharp claws can be used to dig traps.

Name: Cromeon
Description: It handles one type of current on each arm. Its entire body is a big electricity store that can be channeled through one or both limbs.

Name: Keromb
Description: Most people are aware of its anger management issues. It can be witnessed exploding just to reset the immense amount of heat in its body.

Name: Bulbrit
Description: It uses its two cable-like arms to gather electric particles from the air, allowing it to recharge. It enjoys swinging its arms while doing it.

Name: Bouldcran
Description: It can control rock and crystal with the stone in its heads and can smash minerals to dust with its tail too.

Name: Blimpapa
Description: Its more social Nexomon than Baloompa, but generally thinks only of travel and adventure.

Name: Baloompa
Description: A free soul wandering among the clouds. It likes to be left alone with its freedom, especially when it has a chance to land and get some rest.

Name: Virox
Description: This Nexomon can come in many sizes. Its passive look and floating movement are compensated with great psychic power.

Name: Cranillow
Description: Wherever someone sees this Nexomon, a sad whistling sound can be heard. Its inexpressive face gives it an even more frightening visage.

Name: Swactrum
Description: Its bird-like form is perfect for controlling the shadows. It flies above its opponents, disappearing and reappearing in advantageous places.

Name: Rubby
Description: Don't leave your belongings unattended around this fluffy Nexomon. It checks every pocket it can for something to steal.

Name: Bactoul
Description: Despite its appearance, it only has one eye in its body. Its other eye-like parts are psychic sensors to detect different wave types, making it virtually impossible to ambush.

Name: Deember
Description: This Nexomon can control fire. It small antlers collect static energy from the air, while its hooves collect heat from the soil.

Name: Varawirl
Description: It uses its double tail to form whirlpools. Most of its attacks have a spinning effect that ups its potency.

Name: Antlorm
Description: Its two huge antlers are real storm attractors, no one has ever seen the true potential of Antlorm's lightning storm when imbued with fire.

Name: Bomriol
Description: This Nexomon uses its fluffy chest for defense while landing attacks with its heavy feet. Its twin leaf wings distract its opponents while the bloom on its back allows for greater attacks.

Name: Bloomriol
Description: Its wide variety of skills make it perfect for almost any type of tamer. It can use any part of its body as a diversion or to deliver powerful attacks.

Name: Deebuz
Description: It excels at combining attacks, the twin manes made of fire emanating from its shoulders providing natural defense.

Name: Ploriol
Description: A small flying Nexomon with delicate but sharp-edged wings that can summon the power of the forest. It uses its tail as a pummeling weapon against opponents.

Name: Shardrine
Description: This elegant and swift Nexomon is made from the toughest natural metals. Despite its weight, it manages to move without making any noise.

Name: Shardrillion
Description: It skillfully digs tunnels, looking for its favorite crystals to eat. Although its incredible heavy, it makes only a soft dragging sound when moving.

Name: Enercer
Description: It flies primarily during the rainy season. Dubbed "Bringer of the Storm" because thunder is sure to follow just after its appearance.

Name: Scaratic
Description: It charges electricity from the objects it locates on the ground.

Name: Madamusa
Description: Its psychic power is equivalent to the number of creatures on its heads. Each of these creatures have hypnotic abilities which makes it very difficult to approach.

Name: Brumenie
Description: It appears in very foggy locations, the wisps at its hands granting the power to materialize objects or conjure illusions.

Name: Sounse
Description: A very sensitive Nexomon with the ability to hear from very long distances away. Its special connection with the wind makes it an excellent weather forecaster.

Name: Moga
Description: A tamer's best friend. There are several friendly and loyal Nexomon, but none so much as Moga. For some reason, its always hungry. Do not feed it grapes!

Name: Medlass
Description: This cute Nexomon can be heard humming for most of the day. Some say it is to train its viperish living hair that seems to have a mind of its own.

Name: Brumtler
Description: It can materialize or dematerialize at will and has at its disposal powerful ghostly skills.

Name: Runk
Description: A seasoned burglar. When caught, it never hesitates to show its street fighting skills.

Name: Mound
Description: It has superior senses and is an expert at using supersonic currents. It can hear predators well before they can locate it.

Name: Caninui
Description: It excels at telekinetic powers and with only a little concentration can move massive objects at great speeds over vast distances.

Name: Bushnome
Description: A wise and ancient Nexomon that lives in tall grass and near rivers. It is rumored to transform into trees in order to go unnoticed.

Name: Candly
Description: Its agility and acrobatics make it a formidable hunter. When tamed, its possibilities are limited purely by the tamer's skills.

Name: Monkapow
Description: It likes to eat all types of fruit. Even though its able to climb trees with ease, it prefers to shake the tree with its immense strength to force fruit to fall to the ground.

Name: Kawsnow
Description: A flexible and sneaky Nexomon that resides in the coldest places, it detects movement and temperature using its tail and ear like fins.

Name: Scailla
Description: Its tail can generate light in deep waters. Its whiskers and tongue are said to be acidic and its arms are covered with hard scales.

Name: Barboraco
Description: A strong, bulky Nexomon with blazing skills. It trains every day to keep its body fat to a minimum.

Name: Seedko
Description: A light Nexomon capable of soaring in the wind and propelling itself using the two blade leaves on its head. It changes direction using the weights on its lower body.

Name: Harectic
Description: It uses its entire body and tail as a giant whip. It can also use its serpentine moves combined with the spikes around its body to attach or detach from any surface.

Name: Porklet
Description: This little Nexomon makes use of its fat to power its fire attacks.

Name: Scalder
Description: It uses its long tongue to help stabilize underwater, then benefits from a super-aerodynamic tail to increase the speed of its moves.

Name: Rappub
Description: A very domesticated Nexomon, it is sociable and aware of its own combat capabilities. Not so tameable when it grows up, however.

Name: Hoglet
Description: Hoglet is more agile than it looks. It tends to hop back and forth while in battle to keep its stamina and fire from fading.

Name: Pont
Description: Should you venture into a cave, watch out for moving stalactites! This Nexomon is known to be aggressive and packs a punch.

Name: Seedkorsky
Description: A dynamic Nexomon whose movements resemble a spinning dance in the air. It has total control of its bodies during flight.

Name: Hinazuru
Description: Pride is the main trait of this Nexomon. You don't want to make it angry.

Name: Stalagca
Description: This spiky Nexomon benefits from all the minerals carried by underground rivers, which adds an extra layer of hardness to its armor.

Name: Eqo
Description: It prefers dark places where light cannot affect its eyes. Virtually blind, it navigates using supersonic squeaks.

Name: Soniqo
Description: Its large ears provide two functions: navigation and absorption of electric particles in the air.

Name: Eqoloptera
Description: Its great hearing and infra-red vision allow it to attack swiftly. It stands on its two feet to channel electricity.

Name: Minet
Description: Its psychic abilities allow it to rewind memories, making some people believe they've gone back in time.

Name: Sectoc
Description: Ever feel like time moves too slow or too fast? Perhaps this Nexomon was playing tricks on you nearby.

Name: Nakazuru
Description: Its aerodynamics are above most flying Nexomon. You won't even see it fly by.

Name: Malitress
Description: It is said to be behind all the paranormal activity in most haunted places.

Name: Folicurse
Description: It prefers to be left alone. Should you enter a house haunted by a Folicurse, prepare to experience paranormal activity.

Name: Senshizuru
Description: An imposing silhouette soars the skies. One of the largest and strongest Nexomon, its wings can generate winds up to 120 MPH.

Name: Poyal
Description: An adorable Nexomon dressed as a sailor. Always ready for action and extremely loyal.

Name: Puggard
Description: This trusty Nexomon is known to take too many risks during battle, making it a little unreliable.

Name: Orologikus
Description: This Nexomon is in a totally different league than Minets. Studies show it can slow down or accelerate time for its surroundings.

Name: Brauncer
Description: Loyal and super strong, its fighting spirit requires a disciplined and skillful tamer.

Name: Jeloon
Description: A squishy, translucid inhabitant of deep waters. Its carefree personality is contagious.

Name: Jeliflo
Description: Although it is seen as being rather intelligent, it cares very little for anything else other than dancing in the water and going with the flow.

Name: Chowser
Description: It enjoys cooking using only natural ingredients. Don't think it will be willing to share any of its food!

Name: Cuisizle
Description: A master of spicy high cuisine. Its opponents always get over-cooked.

Name: Roclas
Description: It is ridiculously strong and able to lift and carry big mineral boulders that it devours during a battle for a boost.

Name: Snush
Description: Because of its slow nature, it relies on paralyzing opponents with sleeping spores to defend itself.

Name: Fanling
Description: This Nexomon is fast and elusive which makes it difficult to catch. Its hopping movement generates small gusts of wind.

Name: Jeliflux
Description: This Nexomon can grow up to seven feet. It's best not to underestimate it during battle!

Name: Fandiose
Description: Fandiose are considerable faster than the average Nexomon, but its greatest perk is the long distances it can travel without getting tired.

Name: Shloom
Description: It benefits from the sun's power. The colorful flower on its shell is a warning to enemies.

Name: Swamplow
Description: The viscous cover of its shell traps all kind of objects, such as branches, moss, sludge, and curious travelers who dare to touch.

Name: Fainglori
Description: Its dance is something to be admired. Too bad it also serves as a warning to its opponents of an imminent attack.

Name: Minetor
Description: Minetor is a walking power plant armed with two gigantic bulldozer-like pincers. Be careful when taming it.

Name: Kromicide
Description: It's always in a bad mood. It doesn't hide away like other ghost Nexomon and instead wants to be seen to give people goosebumps.

Name: Prankrow
Description: When wandering through lonely locales, make sure to differentiate real scarecrows from this Nexomon. Its favorite prank is named "scare and chase".

Name: Durtacles
Description: It rolls dirt balls containing various minerals which serve as a temporary shelter.

Name: Excravator
Description: Even though it possesses powerful electric attacks, its weapon of choice is an enormous pincer.

Name: Calfter
Description: A strong willed Nexomon that learns very fast, especially new attack techniques. It gets easily distracted, but always strives to become powerful.

Name: Calplex
Description: Its skull is as strong as those of mineral Nexomon and can break rocks with its headbutt.

Name: Blit
Description: A fire Nexomon who loves night festivals. Contact with tamers increases its power and brightness.

Name: Glontern
Description: It loves festivals and celebrations. It tends to live near towns and often mingles with the townspeople at night.

Name: Lamparos
Description: A powerful fire container with a strong sense of honor. It likes to guide lost travelers to the nearest inn.

Name: Tundri
Description: Tundri is a small merry Nexomon that enjoys creating big snowflakes with several different shapes and patterns.

Name: Tundrox
Description: It creates an inaudible sound that can change the direction of a storm. It enjoys hiding under snow to surprise both its prey and its companions.

Name: Bullogan
Description: A powerful wrestler with a wide variety of moves, it likes to grab, toss, submit, and smash its opponents while showing off.

Name: Globlob
Description: A Nexomon with a bubbly core. Its body is a perfect mix of active chemicals that produces a nice smell.

Name: Stalkee
Description: A master of disguise with lightning-quick reflexes. Its shears through opponents with its claws in the blink of an eye.

Name: Scooptor
Description: Its mechanical appearance and the sheer force of its pincers makes this Nexomon a formidable and intimidating opponent.

Name: Rust
Description: It uses its steel helmet for both offense and defense.

Name: Rustung
Description: A versatile fighter, it relies on its armor's durability and superior physical strength.

Name: Dracly
Description: An acrobatic flying Nexomon with powerful wings. Its wind moves are empowered at nighttime.

Name: Chirrent
Description: This Nexomon is fast and very competitive. When it reaches top speed, it leaves a trail of static that can paralyze whoever touches it.

Name: Leechy
Description: This cute little Nexomon has a lot of tricks under its wings... and a furry tail.

Name: Blublub
Description: A bubbly Nexomon containing a mysterious foam core. Its very curious but shy at the same time.

Name: Gomarm
Description: "Be like rubber" its master said, and so it trains tirelessly to attain, as instructed, the state of mind and elastic force.

Name: Ostrolt
Description: This Nexomon is among the fastest of ground based Nexomon. Some say it's as fast as lightning and its chirp is so loud that it sounds like thunder as it reaches top speed.

Name: Rustu
Description: Its armor can resist most attacks while minimizing damage taken.

Name: Mantrass
Description: A fighting expert with plenty of blades covering its body. Its attack speed is something to behold.

Name: Malevodo
Description: Its dance invokes unknown powers capable of controlling its opponents' movements.

Name: Malenostra
Description: Know to be very territorial, it usually stays in the vicinity of the place it is guarding.

Name: Goateeze
Description: An outwardly calm Nexomon. When it wants to play, it becomes very energetic and jumps around like an excitable human child.

Name: Mantoo
Description: Its eyes grant it an impressive field of view. It also has razor sharp twin leaves on its tail.

Name: Guazharm
Description: Master of elasticity, its fighting style is based around stretching its limbs to amass and release power swiftly.

Name: Streamole
Description: A small and seemingly fragile Nexomon, it relies on its evasiveness and a slippery body to use its water attacks from a safe location.

Name: Lumbi
Description: Lumbi has a very short temper and is known as a skilled fighter.

Name: Potpot
Description: Widely regarded as a friendly Nexomon that enjoys the companionship of humans.

Name: Goatlanche
Description: It makes a low-pitched sound that can summon snow avalanches anywhere, at any time. It becomes super energetic when in a playful mood.

Name: Streamoad
Description: It uses its inseparable stick to slap at opponents. Thanks to its palette shaped tail, it can swim in any body of water at ridiculous speeds.

Name: Vodo
Description: It enjoys playing pranks by linking its mind and body with unwary tamers.

Name: Babicle
Description: This Nexomon forms from the purest water inside ice formations. It likes to pose as a stalactite but are often exposed by its breathing.

Name: Streamog
Description: This Nexomon can jump up to 15 times its own height. Its eyes allow it to see in murky waters while its crown-like fin serves as camouflage.

Name: Neglente
Description: Its power comes from its branches. Its root legs are very strong and give it incredible speed.

Name: Tiki
Description: It can be found in dark ruins, caves, and abandoned villages. It usually stays away from towns, since it's walking fire-hazard.

Name: Shardberg
Description: It can cause avalanches and blizzards with the horn on its forehead, making it difficult to spot amongst all the heavy snowdrift.

Name: Outgrov
Description: It enjoys sunlight above anything else and dislikes the chill of winter.

Name: Shardice
Description: This Nexomon enjoys exploring and can create or melt ice at will. It often tests its strength by headbutting others.

Name: Bombargrof
Description: Bombargrofs is an alert and agile Nexomon, with the ability to learn and use any kind of fire technique.

Name: Bomblasta
Description: It can jump, roll, and turn itself into a fire ball which is very difficult to avoid.

Name: Hohopi
Description: A friendly and warm Nexomon, it is loyal and very protective of those it loves.

Name: Mojompu
Description: Its reflexes are unmatched in the Nexomon world. It can jump very high and force in its legs to use as a fearsome weapon.

Name: Domigator
Description: A master of underwater stealth. In rivers, lakes, coasts, during heavy rain or fog, it blends in with its surroundings perfectly, waiting to launch its powerful bite.

Name: Singletti
Description: A special type of Nexomon that is always looking for its soulmate, Singlette.

Name: Croncho
Description: A black-gloved thief that uses stealth while underwater. Its tail is so powerful that it can cut a tree in half.

Name: Cruff
Description: A naughty water Nexomon, skillful at stealing items from shores. After being tamed it becomes very loyal and noble.

Name: Ribombo
Description: It doesn't pay too much attention to anything that could stress it out and lives a tranquil life absorbed in its own dreams.

Name: Foxdra
Description: It obtains energy from mystical sources. The shards on its back produce a chiming sound and its power doubles if it can eat its favorite meal.

Name: Couplet
Description: The amazing plant duo. They have seperate bodies but a synergy without match that allows them to fight as a single Nexomon.

Name: Singlette
Description: It releases the sweetest fragrance to attract its soulmate, Singletti.

Name: Quarmor
Description: Its body shape allows it to spin like a giant drill.

Name: Sandillo
Description: Small, cute and a little clumsy. This Nexomon is covered in a hard shell that allows it to roll around deserts.

Name: Croo
Description: Its flocks can be found on almost every coast. Sailors use Croo flocks to seek land.

Name: Cadeto
Description: It oversees training the youngest Croos and whoever else wants to join the flock.

Name: Woozy
Description: A fluffy Nexomon that resides on high plains. Its wool allows it to store lots of static power.

Name: Gravello
Description: Its harder shell and sharp spikes don't hinder its movement. It can rapidly dig holes into the ground.

Name: Ponic
Description: It hops around on a haunted toy. No one knows its origin.

Name: Magnipub
Description: It is said that it can see into the future, but no one has ever confirmed this. It can the ring in its forehead to create squeaking sounds.

Name: Navrigal
Description: Each Navrigal commands a flock of Croo. It is a skillful fighter and a superb strategist.

Name: Frictingle
Description: It channels static energy through its tail then releases massive amounts of energy in the form of wild electric charges.

Name: Starckal
Description: It can power-up any Psychic-type move with the ring on its hand and project powerful beams with its forehead ring. It is particularly skilled at creating multiple illusions.

Name: Sunnos
Description: A powerful and sometimes malicious psychic Nexomon, that people often confuse with Ghost-type. The ring on its forehead creates very powerful illusions.

Name: Tiliamber
Description: A hot-blooded Nexomon whose smoke-like whiskers can produce smoke screens. It has immense strength in its arms.

Name: Blazetilia
Description: A fire Nexomon with twin fire blades in its arms. Its speed and powerful whipping tail should be watched.

Name: Skunqeau
Description: A friendly and adorable Nexomon, that is always looking to socialize. It can control its smell better than Skunqute.

Name: Giddiyelp
Description: This Nexomon can be bothersome when it groups with others, as they tend to attack tamers for no reason.

Name: Mallish
Description: Its main defense mechanism is to smash oponents with its hammer-shaped head.

Name: Skunqute
Description: Its adorable appearance belies its foul smell, which is its main defense against opponents.

Name: Mallark
Description: It uses its twin hammer head to tackle and knock down its opponents. It also boasts good reflexes underwater and great water techniques.

Name: Skounquet
Description: The once adorable paws of a Skunqeau transformed into pummeling hammers with sharp nails.

Name: Centeror
Description: A real nightmare. Master of the night, always haunting tamers and other Nexomon.

Name: Frogick
Description: This Nexomon packs a powerful kick and can blow any opponent away.

Name: Cranoad
Description: Its kicking power is so great that it uses it to bounce on surroundings to confuse its opponent before landing a final disabling blow.

Name: Teslad
Description: The smartest of all Nexomon, it knows practically everything about electricity. You can't allow yourself to make a mistake against it.

Name: Graciful
Description: It's known to use beautiful flowers and its elegance as a tactic during battle.

Name: Floreina
Description: Many Nexomon are inclined to serve and obey Floreina. Is it because of its fabulous smell? Or perhaps something more... magical?

Name: Tesling
Description: A curious and intelligent Nexomon. What it lacks in strength it compensates with intelligence and proficiency in electric skills.

Name: Thrammer
Description: This Nexomon is full of surprises. Every part of its body is a potential weapon.

Name: Parchidna
Description: Its superb mobility on almost any terrain, strong legs, and large size makes it a terrifyingly good hunter.

Name: Worb
Description: A sneaky Nexomon with poor eyesight. The shiny orb on its backs is not its abdomen, but a jewel that helps crystalize its enemies.

Name: Mimi
Description: A quiet Nexomon. Master of psychic projection. Kids are often scared of it because of its appearance, but it's a very calm, kind Nexomon.

Name: Grimmon
Description: Grimmon is the manifestation of fear. Only brave and expert tamers should approach it, and then with great caution.

Name: Ripha
Description: It takes a keen eye to spot one of these Nexomon. It's the dark ghost of the Nexomon world.

Name: Volpressor
Description: This Nexomon is an electrical power emitter and is not just incredibly smart but can also manipulate electricity at will with any part of its body.

Name: Devoul
Description: Lacking expression, this Nexomon is considered a rare apparition who wanders aimlessly. There is a glimpse of sadness in its masks.

Name: Holoch
Description: Its nest is always covered in shiny cocoons waiting to hatch into numerous Worbs.

Name: Rapi
Description: This charming Nexomon loves to sunbathe while leaning on its powerful tail, which it also uses to crack open nuts.

Name: Rapilux
Description: Elegant and flamboyant - exactly the cover it needs to hide its resourceful abilities.

Name: Imbuzi
Description: A daredevil Nexomon that jumps from rock to rock on mountainsides. Its horns generate fire to keep it warm.

Name: Mimorus
Description: Its projection techniques provide a good defense, but it also takes mimicking to the next level, using its skills to distract and attack.

Name: Pongo
Description: This Nexomon lives in a herd on the slopes of steep mountains. Its fire wool helps keep it warm during blisteringly cold winters.

Name: Imburion
Description: It can generate fire from its horns and wrap itself in flames when facing a tough opponent.

Name: Florauga
Description: It uses its four sensors to search for food and stay aware of enemies. The extension at the tip of its leaf is used to listen to its surroundings.

Name: Auga
Description: Although living primarily underwater, Auga is considered a plant Nexomon. It helps maintain riverways by keeping the water clean.

Name: Hydrose
Description: When fully grown, it searches for large bodies of water like lakes. There are legends about a giant Hydrose attacking ships in the past, but there is no evidence to support these claims.

Name: Duh
Description: A special Nexomon from the far east. Information about it is sparse at best.

Name: Quarauga
Description: Quarauga's flowers float around and protect it from harm. It can perform various attacks using any of its flowers.

Name: Bisina
Description: Swift, agile, and smart. This Nexomon makes lightning-fast decisious faster than any other Nexomon. Experienced tamers know its true potential.

Name: Bira
Description: Its sharp reflexes - and sharper nails - make it a great hunter and tracker.

Name: Spektar
Description: A ghostly manifestation of ancient Nexomon. It channels ancient energies to gather tremendous power.

Name: Hydrip
Description: This Nexomon excels at putting out fires.

Name: Moonline
Description: As its name suggest, Moonline takes power from the moonlight. It has adapted several receivers, like its mushroom shaped head, for this purpose.

Name: Nekpanchi
Description: Its puffy paws are weapons. With its instinct to fight, it can harden itself to bash its opponents.

Name: Biralo
Description: Even without reaching its full potential, this Nexomon can outmatch most of its competitors in terms of speed and agility.

Name: Duktar
Description: A floating apparition that enjoys chasing people in lonely places or haunted mountain forests.

Name: Coral
Description: This free spirit of the sea has a natural power that restores entire eco systems. It moves in groups, and wherever it goes, coral reefs become full of color.

Name: Greben
Description: Dubbed the "saints of the ocean", it makes coral and algae grow wherever it goes. Most of its skills are summoned after a traditional dance with its fan-like tail.

Name: Felclaw
Description: A black belt master of the martial arts. Its kicks are only surpassed by its steel-claw style. It can also land devastating kicks covered in flames.

Name: Nekgiri
Description: Nekgiri is an all-around fighter that adds some flashy kicks to its previously learned punching style. It channels its inner energy to generate flames.

Name: Siki
Description: Despite its size, this Nexomon is very selfconfident and can be seen hiding under dry leaves or absorbing sunlight out int he wild. It feeds on fruit and fresh leaves.

Name: Sikihob
Description: Sikihobs uses its staff as a weapon and is known for mastering martial techniques from the far east.

Name: Sikipha
Description: Beware of its plant techniques! This Nexomon combines nature with physical attacks to make it very difficult to read during battle.

Name: Sae
Description: It enjoys colorful objects and loves all varieties of sweet food.

Name: Lunabelle
Description: Its body is made of a very strong magnetic material. It uses its orbs to distract enemies.

Name: Palsae
Description: Palsae boasts more variation in color than Sae, but its colors are not only for show. It uses them to hide among flowers from which it collects its beloved nutrients.

Name: Moonette
Description: Moonette develops a second orb that floats around it. Its hair and skirt are made of pure magnetite filaments that interact with other minerals in its surroundings.

Name: Dalsae
Description: Its color patterns have inspired famous paintings. It's also known for its swiftness, explosiveness, and majestic power.

Name: Grebal
Description: It carries a pearl wherever it goes as both a memento of its childhood and to serve as a booster for its powers. This elusive Nexomon can use the shell in its head for defense.

Name: Moonica
Description: Born from magnetic mineral deposits, a small rock orbits around it.

Name: Muu
Description: Only tamers searching for ghost Nexomon stay when they spot a Muu. Its surrounded by a heavy atmosphere and some say that darkness follows it.

Name: Yomnom
Description: Its symbiotic relationship with sweetness translates into raw power. While a little heavy, it is extremely alert because of all the sugar in its body.

Name: Omentic
Description: A cloud-like Electric-type Nexomon capable of seperating its body cells to attract energy or avoid damage.

Name: Immortis
Description: An undead giant with extreme strength and supernatural powers. Even its tamer gets the shivers when summoning it into battle.

Name: Glunch
Description: It specializes in using sugar-powered psychic energy. No one dares wonder what would happen if it used it all at once.

Name: Yummo
Description: Yummo obtains its powers from a sugar rush. It loves all kinds of sweets, especially those with chocolate.

Name: Carcaros
Description: Faster and stronger than Muu, its red eye is perfect for seeing in the dark. It leaves a crimson trail when using its spectral powers.

Name: Arispauva
Description: Years of studying human behavior has allowed this Nexomon to take on human-like form. It is often confused with a real human.

Name: Omepark
Description: Its body is charged with so much pure energy that it glows. It can connect to power sources with its tail to powering up.

Name: Omecharge
Description: A triple minded Nexomon who likes to chat with itself. Unfortunately, its three inseperable heads don't often agree. Watch out when they synchronize!

Name: Mermella
Description: This Nexomon is a very rare sight, even for experienced sailors. Its hair becomes liquid when underwater, but outside is silky and brilliant. It propels itself at great speeds with its tail.

Name: Paupo
Description: This Nexomon has a very mysterious origin. It can be seen outside of towns disguised as a human. No one knows its expression is so forlorn.

Name: Tantrunt
Description: It doesn't like to be close to tamers, which makes it even more angry than it appears to be. It benefits from this anger to power its inner flame.

Name: Sirnymfa
Description: Known as the protector of the sea, the few sailors that have seen this Nexomon became mute for weeks because of its beauty and magical powers.

Name: Reeferus
Description: An extremely fast underwater Nexomon. Most of its attacks benefit from its slippery leafshaped fins and from the air pressure generated from micro-bubbles in its skin.

Name: Wargoyle
Description: A lonely Nexomon. Even after earning its trust, a tamer must go through further tests to be truly worthy of leading it in battle.

Name: Waser
Description: A cautious, very defensive Nexomon. Tamers requires a great deal of patience to earn its trust, and even more for its friendship.

Name: Grath
Description: While its slow and deep breaths give off a calm appearance, its brute force is beyond imagination. It trains with whatever it finds.

Name: Sorvian
Description: While its speed is commendable, its greatest perk is its intuition, which allows it to move across the skies as if predicting where danger will strike next.

Name: Lovidovi
Description: Lovidovi is the literal example of duality, its two poles complement each other to keep its powerful psychic energy in check. It loves all beings regardless of what they are.

Name: Lurkennie
Description: This Nexomon is infamous for playfully making its prey nervous until it is tired to fight back. It feeds on anxious thoughts.

Name: Glidlee
Description: Soaring like a leaf in the wind, it doesn't worry about speed or agility. It almost seems like it has a sixth sense that allows it to avoid opponents just by letting itself go with the wind.

Name: Algon
Description: Although this Nexomon lives underwater, it possesses plant characteristics and powers. It occasionally pops out of the water to perform photosynthesis.

Name: Rapnux
Description: An eternal wanderer and master of battle. Its reflexes far surpass those of any warrior and it can move silently.

Name: Smanic
Description: A small Nexomon that gathers electrical charge from the particles in humid air.

Name: Resonic
Description: Resonic has several electrical amplifiers throughout its body, especially on its wings, which act like giant lightning rods.

Name: Lovinu
Description: Lovinu is a real mystery, all that is known about it is that it has two different psychic energy charges at each side of its body, as if it were different poles.

Name: Lurkost
Description: A quiet crawling Nexomon that can turn transparent in order to mimic its environment. Nobody knows why it prefers to crawl, perhaps it enjoys simpy playing with its prey.

Name: Goblat
Description: This Nexomon is all about vibrations, hearing and emitting supersonic waves, which it converts into electricity to be stored in its spiky fur.

Name: Antarzen
Description: From the deepest ice lands, this Nexomon emanates a visible mist that freezes everything around it. It can direct such attacks using the fins on its tail and head.

Name: Florozard
Description: Its almost impossible to spot this Nexomon unless its willing to get close to you. It has perfect camouflage techinques, moving across leaves and branches in the blink of an eye.

Name: Boilgog
Description: This Nexomon's body is made from melting and boiling materials. Its movements are slow, scorching everything at its path. Although it can reshape most of its body, it does have four legs.

Name: Hyphoon
Description: The very few that have been tamed were found in the eye of hurricanes. For some reason, it is attracted to them.

Name: Blizstrong
Description: Blizstrong can usually be found in high-altitude locations, with only a few people claiming to have seen it. Giant footprints on hard-to-reach places raise the question of where it lives.

Name: Basil
Description: This dragon Nexomon is very friendly and playful. Although it cannot fly very high, it lifts off from the ground and glides when happy.

Name: Divette
Description: Its psychic skills enhance its sound and vibration-based attacks. Its floating rings act as giant speakers which create illusion with soundwaves.

Name: Wysil
Description: Even though it can't truly fly, it can remain a few feet off the ground for long periods. Its super strong, with great defense and resistance because of its dragon scales.

Name: Gradow
Description: A spectral Nexomon full of mysteries, enclosed in an ancient structure. Allegedly created by an obscure curse. Its motivation and purpose are yet to be discovered.

Name: Drare
Description: The smallest offspring of the ancient red dragon, its eyes shine like fire. Don't make jokes about its short arms or you might end up getting roasted.

Name: Ignigon
Description: Its horns and chest are made of fire crystal, the archeological proof that it is descendant of a legendary fire dragon. It can't fly properly but are nevertheless proud of its wings.

Name: Blizzaur
Description: A huge stomping ice dragon with a prehistoric bad mood. Its frozen heart makes it difficult to tame.

Name: Tarragon
Description: Colloquially known as the terror of the skies. A true descendant of the dragons. Its strength, defense, and resistance are overwhelming, requiring a master tamer to capture it.

Name: Cryzzard
Description: Nicknamed the "sentry of winter", this small Nexomon behaves like a soldier and lives mainly in cold landscapes.

Name: Blizzarm
Description: This ice dragon leaves a sub-zero trail that allows it to move swiftly wherever it goes.

Name: Briar
Description: This small seed-like Nexomon makes a curious noise like those of a trumpet. The bulb on its back widens as if it will bloom at any moment.

Name: Oren
Description: Its mineral crest resembles a steep rocky mountain where it usually resides. It feeds on all sorts of minerals.

Name: Orgot
Description: Orgot is the only mid-stage dragon Nexomon that can fly. It's often seen flying through clouds. It is the descendant of a mountain dragon.

Name: Acegon
Description: A fire-breathing dragon with powerful wings and horns that appear to be the embers of a fire. The flame on its tail changes to an intense blue color when it gets mad.

Name: Flotter
Description: An attentive and brave Nexomon. Its body is so lightweight that it moves across the air like a feather.

Name: Dratter
Description: A nimble Nexomon that uses its long fluffy tails to soar in the air unexpectedly fast. It possesses great physical strength.

Name: Chaparral
Description: After the seed on its body germinates, its body develops legs, a vine tail, and a flower crest.

Name: Oregoon
Description: A true mountain dragon. No one knows how a heavy like this can fly at great altitudes with ease. Its skin and wings are rock-hard.

Name: Foreer
Description: A majestic Nexomon of the forest. It stores solar energy in its bloom crest and tail. The tail also serves as a weapon during battle.

Name: Voltaic
Description: It can fly at considerable high altitudes. Its wings, horns, and chest remain as evidence of its dragon legacy. Oh, and it also has the power to summon lightning.

Name: Furrygon
Description: Its tail is so long that it can be seen holding part of it while standing. Despite being so fluffy, it uses its tail as a weapon in battle. Try not to get hit!

Name: Volt
Description: Its tail, forehead, chest, and neck are covered with a thin layer of scales for protection and isolation. Its bite is as strong as its bark.

Name: Deyama
Description: Its deep-red eyes look like portals to another world. Don't stare for too long or you'll be in trouble.

Name: Volnamic
Description: Its large ears allow for better aerodynamics, while its mid-size wings enable soft landings at speed. Its scales provide extra protection during combat.

Name: Phantra
Description: This bat-like specter prefers nights with full moons to scare those who dare to enter its territory. It feeds on all sorts of emotions, allowing it to control its prey's mind.

Name: Wadgon
Description: This feathered, viper-like drake produces a stunning humming sound from its rattling tail scales. The crown on its head can reflect light like a mirror.

Name: Deyam
Description: If you spot a Deyam in the wild, it's usually as bad as a nightmare you cannot wake up from.

Name: Wadtail
Description: This elegant Nexomon has legs strong enough to support its body but prefers to hop or levitate using its wings.

Name: Horget
Description: A loyal, playful Nexomon with those it has formed a bond with, and a wild beast against those it has not.

Name: Lume
Description: Not a recommended partner for those who love to hug their Nexomon. Lume's head, paws and tail are completely engulfed in flames.

Name: Dichala
Description: A fierce praire hunters, it excels at lurking and then swiftly attacking. Its sense of smell and hearing is astounding.

Name: Dinja
Description: It has short legs, adorable big ears, and a huge fluffy tail. Since it isn't a good runner, it prefers to hop.

Name: Namansi
Description: King of the prairies, it has three tails which serves as both a distraction and to trap its opponents during battle.

Name: Vainok
Description: With its water attacks and long tail, its opponents rarely manage to escape its assault. Extremely hard to find and even more difficult to catch.

Name: Noki
Description: An amphibious flying Nexomon with a heroic spirit. Its main characteristics are self confidence and loyalty.

Name: Lumefur
Description: The flame on its head as a child became a mane. This Nexomon is the perfect balance of power, speed, and... sharp claws!

Name: Mara
Description: An adorable and intelligent Nexomon who knows how to use its charm in its favor during tamer battles. Loves to be pet.

Name: Lumerei
Description: Being armed with sharp fangs and claws makes it one of the most intimidating Nexomon one could hope not to encounter in battle.

Name: Trebly
Description: Always eager to prove the durability of its horns, it loves nothing more than a simple headbutting competition.

Name: Hainok
Description: It has a strange property that allows it to walk on water without sinking. It can reach ridiculous speeds when flying.

Name: Treclay
Description: A great hunter despite its small hands. It has even been witnessed digging mountain passes just by smashing its head against rock.

Name: Mearn
Description: A wild Nexomon that inhabits prairies and mountain ranges. It uses its entangled tails to read the wind while hunting.

Name: Marasuma
Description: Its mystic eyes are as deceiving as its appearance. Beneath all the foilage are more than just one thorn waiting to be usad as a weapon.

Name: Yarnesty
Description: A balanced and precise hunter. It can detect and manipulate wind streams from any direction and use them to defend or attack in battle.

Name: Felarnia
Description: This Nexomon is an extremely capable hunter and a masters of the wind, using it as a platform to double jump and reach airborne enemies.

Name: Raksuma
Description: Tall and elegant, considered the guardian of the forest and protector of life. It doesn't enjoy fighting other Nexomon and tends to be overprotective of others.

Name: Gekoko
Description: A curious Nexomon with the ability to walk on any surface with its sticky feet. It challenges itself to stay hidden from others for long periods of time.

Name: Kamelevo
Description: A sneaky lightning fast Nexomon with the ability to blend into any environment. It sends electrical charges to its skin cells creating a chemical reaction that changes its color.

Name: Masquiti
Description: Often mistaken for a Ghost-type Nexomon, it is a Psychic-type with a somewhat obscure sense of humor.

Name: Reptomotor
Description: A fast Nexomon with immense agility and flashy attacks. It can to conceal its presence, but rarely uses it as it is confident in its own strength.

Name: Tresaur
Description: Abnormally resistant to physical attacks, it can make its tails as soft as mud or as hard as steel on a whim.

Name: Feliblanqo
Description: It has a mixture of different emotions, which are reflected in its erratic fighting style. Only a true master tamer can take advantage of its potential.

Name: Masqat
Description: This quiet Nexomon can easily blend into human society. It is a perfect companion, in sharp contrast to its younger form, Masquiti.

Name: Behilda
Description: A ghost Nexomon that can be found wandering the darkness. It likes to detach its head to scare off opponents.

Name: Noocidal
Description: Noocidal uses all its limbs to perform advanced battle techniques. Thus, it normally has its head attached to its body, unlike Heddecas.

Name: Wyverne
Description: The heaviest of the greater drakes can be seen hunting Tyrants around the Outlands near Parum. Citizens have grown used to this sight, and adventurers use this opportunity to explore without fear of Tyrants.

Name: Boscage
Description: One would expect to find this greater drake in the woods, but nobody has been able to pinpoint his home. As a matter of fact, there is no documentation of Boscage ever fighting a Tyrant at all, which baffles dragon enthusiasts.

Name: Heddeca
Description: Its always smiling regardless of the situation. Having one of its arms occupied holding its head, it uses the remaining limbs to generate powerful ghost attacks.

Name: Glamond
Description: This voracious greater drake is busy all day and night waging war against the countless Tyrants who roam the Frozen Tundra for unknown reasons. Glamond can be found sleeping in icy caves, where it has befriended some of the local Nexomite miners.

Name: Graloon
Description: Perhaps the most efficient of the greater drakes. When a Tyrant brings chaos somewhere in the Outlands, Graloon is often seen diving out of the skies like a meteorite. Tyrants have come to acknowledge its strength and actively avoid any confrontation.

Name: Tyrake
Description: Unlike most Greater Drakes, Tyrake has chosen to dwell near its birthplace: the skyward country of Drake Isles. While unquestionably strong, Tyrake does not often confront Tyrants, for they are not foolish enough to invade the home turf of the dragons themselves.

Name: Dracon
Description: The greater drake of blaze dwells around the desert, near the entrance to New Ignitia. On extremely rare occasions he travels underground to rest.

Name: Volta
Description: The greater drake of lightning has no fixed location and adventurers can encoutner him when they least expect it. Volta's sporadic behavior has troubled Tyrants for as long as they can remember.

Name: Krainnull
Description: This greater drake befriended the ghosts of the Immortal Citadel. It's been theorized that he's under a similar curse as them and, as such, Tyrants don't even bother fighting Krainnull, for it would be a pointless encounter.

Name: Nivalis
Description: A cowardly but stunningly cunning Tyrant. Nivalis does not tend to fight other Tyrants head on, and instead relies on careful schemes to grow in power, slowly creeping towards kinghood.

Name: Mystogen
Description: The most intelligent of the greater drakes. It often travels from cave to cave in order to locate Tyrants. It probably helps that it can sense when a Tyrant is nearby using its psychic abilities.

Name: Byeol
Description: This utterly enigmatic Tyrant is... weird? Bizarre? This thing is always staring and smiling. The person writing this entry feels uncomfortable describing Byeol so let's leave it at that.

Name: Petram
Description: A formidable golem that has been waging war against the Laterians for years. Petram is seemingly indestructible and may very well become the next King of Monsters someday simply by enduring any attack without a scratch.

Name: Eurus
Description: A puzzling Tyrant indeed. Although Eurus desires to become the next King of Monsters, he doesn't try at all. Despite being undoubtedly powerful, Eurus spends every day relaxing in the Drake Isles and doesn't even mind living amongst humans. To make the situation even more baffling, dragons don't bother attacking him. How is this all possible?

Name: Ziegler
Description: The King of the Netherworld who oversees the Afterlife. A creature even more ancient than Omnicron himself, and thus, perhaps, not even a Nexomon at all. Not much is known about this powerful being, which may be for the best.

Name: Arqua
Description: The fifth daughter of King Omnicron. This primordial Tyrant of the Seas divided humanity by sinking every ship that dared traverse her domain. Legend has it that she could shapeshift into a human called Merida with questionable volleyball skills.

Name: Fona
Description: The third son of King Omnicron, this primordial Tyrant once engulfed our world in a century of black skies and fire. According to legend, Fona could take the guise of a human being named Fenrir.

Name: Mulcimer
Description: The devious Tyrant of blaze who dwells in the volcanic region of New Ignitia. This despicable monster will scorch the land until he is acknowledged as the King of Monsters.

Name: Nara
Description: The treacherous daughter of King Omnicron who machinated his downfall. Nara is the primordial Tyrant of Life, who teamed up with a human tamer millennia ago to defeat her own father. She is presumably immortal, but her whereabouts today are unknown.

Name: Bolzen
Description: A rare sight indeed, Bolzen's general location is a mystery to most and yet, he always conveniently appears to deal the final blow when another Tyrant is weakened. The Tyrant of Thunder seems capable of traveling throughout the world in an instant, making it a difficult target for the Guild's tamers.

Name: Tikala
Description: Tyrant may not be the most appropriate term to describ Tikala, for he actively avoids conflict and seems to lack any interest in becoming the King of Monsters. He spends most of his time in hiding, which is fine by the Guild and other Tyrants alike.

Name: Ventra
Description: The second daughter of King Omnicron. As the primordial winged Tyrant of the Tempest, she was the very reason humans feared to look up at the sky. She once took the form of a woman called Nadine, but her disguise could barely hold her malevolent aura.

Name: Grunda
Description: King Omnicron’s first-born child, Grunda was a titan of unparalleled strength whose very mood determined the fate of entire countries. His final resting place is somewhere in the desert but, even millennia later, tamers still fear to disturb him.

Name: Luxa
Description: King Omnicron's sixth child. While being relatively young, he is the largest primordial Tyrant. Luxa was a serpent that could smite humanity's greatest armies in the blink of an eye. Legends say that he disguised himself as a man named Zetta to wreak havoc from within cities.

Name: Darine
Description: One of Ziegler's creations, Darine is a loyal servant of the Netherworld King. She serves as one of the many wardens in the Afterlife. Not much else is known about her.

Name: Titan
Description: Titan was created byZieglerand serves as a warden in the Netherworld. His main role is guarding the gateway between the mortal world and Ziegler’s domain.

Name: Protovados
Description: Amelie's perfect creation. An artificial Tyrant sworn to protect mankind by exterminating other Tyrants once and for all. Vados is exceedingly intelligent, rational, and strong. There is no doubt that he can lead humanity to a new age of prosperity if he so desires.

Name: Omnisun
Description: King Omnicron's true heir/heiress and Nara's own child. A supreme Tyrant who is destinied to rule every Nexomon in the world and shape its very future, for better or for worse. What will you do with such power, (Player's Name)?

Name: Solus
Description: The so-called “Tyrant of Light” is a popular bedtime story of a loving and forgiving Tyrant who seeks to protect humans and Nexomon alike. Of course, there is no such thing as a good Tyrant – but every legend has some truth to it.

Name: Fane
Description: A mysterious Nexomon said to appear only to those who have beaten countless enemies and proven their worth.

Name: Arctivore
Description: Arctivore is a powerful and very loyal Nexomon. It also has an incredible resistance to extreme cold and harsh environments. Watch out for its fangs and sharp claws!

Name: Vados
Description: Amelie’s unbeatable aberration at its full power. All around the world, Tyrants cower in fear upon Vados’s wake. This is Amelie’s ultimate gift to mankind.

Name: Broshield
Description: Broshield is a defensive Nexomon, and not many attacks can pierce through its defenses. The very few attacks that do are met with a thick skin making its defense almost flawless.

Name: Abbadog
Description: Abbadog is a feral Nexomon with a terrible temper. Please approach with caution in the wild as it may attack even if unprovoked.

Name: Felicient
Description: Felicient is a highly agile Nexomon. It wears strange-looking ornaments around its neck, leading to the idea that they can guide tamers to unique ancient treasures.

Name: Ferodile
Description: Ferodile likes to lurk in the wild and surprise unsuspecting tamers from behind. It usually lays on its belly, but in battle, it stands up to intimidate the opponent, this combined with powerful jaws makes most Nexomon avoid them at all times.

Name: Bogarp
Description: Bogarp is an ancient Nexomon, and experts say that they may live for centuries given the right circumstances. Some Nexomon seeks Bogarps for their knowledge.

Name: Columbra
Description: Columbras are dangerous Nexomon as opponents, but many would find it surprising how great companions they are. They particularly enjoy wrapping around their tamers to keep them warm during wintertime.

Name: Mistralion
Description: Mistralion is a very rare wind Nexomon. Not many tamers have spotted one in the wild and the few that have are known to be tamers of the highest caliber. Finding a Mistralion is a challenge, but taming one is even more difficult.

Name: Hurristag
Description: Hurristag is a Nexomon known for its speed and reaction time. This Nexomon is notorious for being extremely hard to catch because of its quick reflexes and speed, both of which can be extremely useful in battle.

Name: Kromatice
Description: Kromatice is a beautiful wind Nexomon and spends most of the time soaring through the skies showing off its beautiful colors. These colors are not just for showoff but also as a distraction for tamers and other Nexomon alike.

Name: Lycopain
Description: Lycopain is well known among tamers for its bad temper. Experts point out that its face looks red due to its persisten bad mood causing constant blood flow and thus giving Lycopain a bright red tone.

Name: Froppe
Description: Froppe is a flamboyant Nexomon that is both stylish and a powerful companion. Tamers love to capture Froppe but quickly regret it due to the high maintenance they require.

Name: Trondle
Description: Trondle has a firm grip, and this makes them highly competent climbers. It is also said that once Trondle grabs you, there is almost no way to escape. Trondle can only be distracted by particular foods, and only then will it let go of you.

Name: Resonect
Description: Resonect is a high voltage Nexomon. Beware of scaring a Resonect as its primary defese is to electrocute anyone who poes a threat to them. That being said, Resonect gets scared quite easily.

Name: Torrex
Description: Torrex enjoys living in turbulent waters. This fact makes them incredible versatile water Nexomon and are almost unmatched in the water. Their fins are colorful and used for intimidation but are also as sharp as any weapon.

Name: Raamu
Description: Raamu is a fearless Nexomon. It never runs from a battle, and it is constantly looking for a challenge to hone its skills. Sadly, not many Nexomon can offer Raamu a challenge, making them very isolated from other Nexomon.

Name: Voltosfere
Description: Voltosfere is a rare electric Nexomon that boasts one of the highest electric outputs out there for any Nexomon. Experts say that at its peak, it is powerful enough to power an entire village by itself.

Name: Weavolt
Description: Weavolt, regardless of its size, is highly agile and excels in both electric and melee attacks. A Weavolt is one of the few Nexomon to be seen training without a tamer to get stronger as they tend to be very competitive.

Name: Wiselie
Description: Wiselie is a night creature, and it really hates bright lights and often avoids being seen in broad daylight. Their special feathers make their movements extremely silent. Opponents rarely get a chance to see what hit them.

Name: Prismazor
Description: Prismazor is a wildly popular plant Nexomon in the Nexomon community and even won a popularity contest among tamers. It not only looks impressive but also battles with incredible skill. This Nexomon is an all-rounder, and it is proven to be the go-to Nexomon for most experienced tamers.

Name: Vaprat
Description: Vaprats are very popular among fire specialists tamers. They are extremely friendly to humans in general. Vaprat has powerful fire skills and is very easy to tame. However, it takes a while for them to work with other Nexomon as a team.

Name: Bedam
Description: Bedam is a very popular Nexomon. It is always carrying a huge log to use as a floating device and also as a weapon. Researches indicate that once a young Bedam finds a good log, it stays with it for the rest of its life.

Name: Maraudin
Description: Maraudin is a very special Nexomon. Experts say that it evolved directly from a Hobyn (an extinct Nexomon). The similarities are evident, including its good nature and friendly behavior. Maraudins are known to share food with other Nexomon in need. No one knows where it gets so much food from though.

Name: Carnagrius
Description: Carnagrius are not particularly fond of humans. A long time ago, humans destroyed their natural habitat making them very cautious of tamers. Although it is tough to earn a Carnagrius trust, once a tamer achieves this feat, they become inseperable.

Name: Jeeta
Description: Jeeta is the fastest Nexomon to date. Not a single Nexomon comes even close to matching its full speed. Jeeta uses its electrified nervous system to jumpstart its muscles like no other Nexomon. You won't even see it coming.

Name: Tephragon
Description: In the past, Tephragon excelled at tracking other Nexomon, making it a favorite among tamers. Rumor has it that the Guild took interest in this ability, and used Tephragon as a template to engineer today's dragons.

Name: Mandrass
Description: A seemingly weak and innocent Nexomon. And yet...

Name: Gemeen
Description: Gemeen not only looks like royalty but also acts like it. Be prepared to impress one if you want to befriend a Gemeen. Precious minerals usually do the trick but don't even think to show up without a present.

Name: Ogoon
Description: A steed of unparalleled speed, and Ziegler's quickest warrior. Ogoon has patrolled the Netherworld of millenia, keeping an eye on any souls attempting to escape his master's grasp.

Name: Anima
Description: A bioengineered "CHAOS" Nexomon. Anima can telepathically generate tornadoes and storms at far away locations without any physical effort. The data used to create Anima is labeled "MCR-136".

Name: Frominence
Description: Frominence, is a direct evolution from the ancient species of Fropip. Tamers are puzzled by its change in personality. Once a shy Nexomon known as Fropip, is now known to be a strong leader whose only concern is the welfare of other Nexomon.

Name: Luhava
Description: It's said that this ancient Nexomon guided brave adventurers across the continent to fulfill their heroic roles, only to disappear shortly after.

Name: Hexia
Description: The most vicious of Ziegler's followers. Hexia is an excellent hunter, tasked with tracking down those who dare escape from the depths of the Netherworld.

Name: Krowr
Description: A behemoth serving on the frontlines of Ziegler's dark army. With his sheer strength, Krowr can relentlessly siege just about any kind of enemy stronghold.

Name: Fulmina
Description: A bioengineered "CHAOS" Nexomon. Fulmina's skin can ignite anything it touches, easily destroying whatever landscape it ventures into. The data used to create Fulmina is labeled "MCR-137".

Name: Agita
Description: A bioengineered "CHAOS" Nexomon. Along a virtually indestructible body, Agita's sheer strength can generate earthquakes across mountains. The data used to create agita is labeled "MCR-135".

Name: Gurgita
Description: A bioengineered "CHAOS" Nexomon. Gurgita seems capable of controlling tidal waves and cause floods over remarkable distances. The data used to create Gurgita is labeled "MCR-138".

Name: Caelesa
Description: Caelesa was an Abyssal Tyrant that raced across the continent, making it exceptionally difficult to hunt down. Whether it was chasing a target or running from something, the Guild could never find out.

Name: Helovolk
Description: An Abyssal Tyrant that dwelled underground restlessly digging seemingly random tunnels, eluding the Guild’s attention for many decades.

Name: Volcel
Description: Volcel was an Abyssal Tyrant that excelled at scouting and locating other living beings, making him quite difficult to chase as he’d always know when enemies were approaching.

Name: Inominox
Description: An elusive and calculating Abyssal Tyrant. Inominox outlived generations of tamers as he carefully picked his fights by never engaging strong opponents.

Name: Kroma
Description: The most recent Abyssal Tyrant. Kroma sought to crush the Immortal Citadel a few years ago, but failed upon clashing with Grandmaster Deena. Kroma is capable of influencing and commanding spirits.

Name: Venefelis
Description: The first recorded Abyssal Tyrant, who awakened shortly after King Omnicron’s downfall. Venefelis attacked the Immortal Citadel, before finally being sealed away in the woods by a hero.

Name: Pluvean
Description: Perhaps the most perplexing of the Abyssal Tyrants. Pluvean emerged from the waters nearPalmaya, and only waited for the Guild to eventually hunt it down, as if it desired its own demise.

Name: Rotramus
Description: Rotramus was an Abyssal Tyrant that would actively avoid any conflict and focus on sleeping deep in the woods, making his pressence as scarce as possible. Nevertheless, paranoia drove the Guild to hunt him down anyway.

Name: Braccus
Description: The strongest of the Abyssal Tyrants. Braccus emerged in the desert, and marched towards dozens of cities leaving only ruin. People were convinced that he’d become the new King of Monsters, until Grandmaster Xanders finally put an end to him.
